metadata.description: Edge case where begin equals end for all hierarchy levels
metadata.physical_interpretation: Single element at each hierarchy level with offset indices

metadata.description: Edge case with 1:1:1 ratio (one column per gridcell, one patch per column)
metadata.physical_interpretation: Homogeneous landscape with no subgrid heterogeneity

metadata.description: Edge case with very high patch-to-gridcell ratio (100 patches per gridcell)
metadata.physical_interpretation: Highly heterogeneous landscape requiring fine-scale representation

metadata.description: Asymmetric subgrid hierarchy with varying ratios across levels
metadata.physical_interpretation: Variable subgrid tiling reflecting heterogeneous land cover distribution

metadata.description: Sparse patch distribution (only 3 patches per gridcell on average)
metadata.physical_interpretation: Simplified land surface with limited plant functional type diversity

notes:
Test data generation assumptions:

1. **Bounds Structure**: All test cases use the bounds_type namedtuple with six integer fields (begg, endg, begc, endc, begp, endp) representing the hierarchical grid structure in CLM (Community Land Model).

2. **Hierarchy Constraints**: 
   - Gridcells (g): begg <= endg
   - Columns (c): begc <= endc  
   - Patches (p): begp <= endp
   - Typical hierarchy: patches > columns > gridcells (reflecting subgrid tiling)
   - All indices are non-negative integers

3. **Physical Realism**:
   - Gridcells represent atmospheric forcing grid
   - Columns represent soil columns with distinct properties
   - Patches represent plant functional types (PFTs) or land cover types
   - Ratios reflect realistic subgrid heterogeneity in land surface models

4. **Test Coverage**:
   - Nominal cases (50%): Tests 1-5 cover typical simulation scales from single-cell to global
   - Edge cases (30%): Tests 6-8 cover boundary conditions (equal indices, minimal ratios, high density)
   - Special cases (20%): Tests 9-10 cover asymmetric and sparse configurations

5. **Index Ranges**:
   - Small simulations: O(1-100) gridcells
   - Medium simulations: O(100-1000) gridcells  
   - Large simulations: O(1000+) gridcells
   - Column/patch ratios vary from 1:1:1 (homogeneous) to 1:20:200 (highly heterogeneous)

6. **MPI Decomposition**: Test 5 demonstrates non-zero starting indices typical of parallel domain decomposition where each processor handles a subset of the global domain.

7. **Validation**: All test cases satisfy the constraints that begin <= end for each hierarchy level and all indices are non-negative integers. The validate_initialization function should verify these constraints plus check that initialization side effects completed successfully.

8. **JIT Compilation**: The _jit variants use the same test data but are compiled with static_argnames=['bounds'] for performance optimization in JAX.
